title.narrative: A Joint Canadian-International Global Health Research, Training and Career Development Program - phase II
Programme conjoint canadien et international de recherche, de formation et de perfectionnement professionnel en santé mondiale - phase II

description.narrative:
This project will contribute to developing a joint Canadian-International Global Health Research, Training and Career Development program. This national, multi-university, and interdisciplinary program will bring together top Canadian researchers and give them the skills they need to become global health leaders. The University of British Columbia (UBC) will serve as host university for the program. Dr Kishor Wasan will be the Scientific Director.
Project funds will cover costs for a second planning meeting to lay out the next phase of the joint program. The meeting will serve to: -develop consensus on the governance structure; -identify UBC's commitment; -determine the core educational components; -establish an evaluation framework for the program; and, -identify a team to develop the business plan, recruitment strategy, and marketing plan.
The meeting will include: -leaders from university-based global health or international health programs -representatives from Networks of Centres of Excellence of Canada -participants from low- and middle-income country educational and health organizations; -students in global health and -directors or program leaders of the Canadian Coalition for Global Health Research, the Canadian Society for International Health, and the Global Health Research Initiative.
The meeting will be held over two days in 2014.
